title: First cut at Android O notification channels
message:
First cut at Android O notification channels

* Create a notification channel for Alarms and another just for media
controls, duplicating a bunch of the notification-building work.
* Go back to v4.app.NotificationCompat. It now handles MediaStyle,
while the v7 version is deprecated.
* Set a custom color for the LED light.
* Merge Notifier’s playChime and vibrate options into one alarm option
since every combination of options requires another channel!

title: Proguard: keep less; fix debugProguard builds for Espresso
message:
Proguard: keep less; fix debugProguard builds for Espresso

* keep less to make a smaller APK
[It’s STILL bigger than the non-Proguard debug build. Keeping only a
portion of the support.v4 library seems to work in the test build, but
can we rely on it for release builds?]
* simplify the Proguard rules
* separate Proguard rules for debugProguard builds so it works for
Espresso tests
* add debugProguardCompile build dependency so debugProguard
builds work reliably rather than sometimes getting a startup error
finding the test runner

+ Allocate more memory for dex and gradle, per build log suggestions

title: Use a Snackbar to reveal/fix muted Alarm volume

title: Pre-Lollipop, unify Paused @ 0:00 with Stopped in the UI
message:
Pre-Lollipop, unify Paused @ 0:00 with Stopped in the UI

For Android L+, the app has Stop *and* Reset (go to Paused @ 0:00)
buttons.

For older Androids, the app only needs one of them. This release
switches it from Reset to Stop.

The difference now matters because the Activity pulses the time display
when Paused, thus upgrading from an older app release needs to change
the stored Reset state to Stopped.

title: inform the user if the Alarm volume is muted
message:
inform the user if the Alarm volume is muted

TODO: Have a German speaker check the translation.

title: Fix: Hide Reset, not Stop, on pre-L Android
message:
Fix: Hide Reset, not Stop, on pre-L Android

Separate Reset from Stop.
The main cycle is Run -> Pause -> Stop.

The Reset button goes to Paused with blinking 0:00. Offer Stop instead
of Reset on Androids without lock-screen notifications. Offer both on
later Androids.

TODO: When upgrading to this app version on pre-L Androids, change the
Paused @ 0:00 state to Stopped.

Call endScheduledUpdates() when stopping, although an outstanding
update message should simply refresh the time display.

title: hide the widget's secondary text on L+
message:
hide the widget's secondary text on L+

The lock screen widget shows the date in its secondary text field.
But Lollipop+ has no lock screen widgets, so leave the field empty
there. This helps Nougat where some combos of Display Size and Font
Size show some of that text on a home screen widget.

Make MainActivity#onStart() save state in case it helps with the
expanded activity lifecycle in Multi-Window Mode.

title: set the notification's accent color where safe
message:
set the notification's accent color where safe

* The aim was to workaround the low-contrast text in Android
M heads-up MediaStyle notifications, but no success there yet.
See http://stackoverflow.com/q/38415467/1682419
* Then I tried using setColor() to set the accent color (behind the
small icon), but it could break various handset builds on Android K-,
it can mess up the background color on Android L-M, and it has no
effect on Android N. — So I just left comments behind.
* Use android.support.v7.app.NotificationCompat everywhere, not a mix
of v4 and v7.

title: make in-activity notifications read-only
message:
make in-activity notifications read-only

… so they don’t need to update the activity.
Within the activity, people should use its own UI,
shouldn’t be able to swipe away the notification,
and tapping the content area in the notification
shouldn’t re-launch the activity.

Alternative: Use its own audio/visual/vibrate
alarm feedback within the activity instead of a
notification. That’d fit the style guide but be less
consistent and wouldn’t give immediate feedback
that starting the timer turns on the notification
that’s accessible from the lock screen.

fix some

tags to

title: tweak the Java code style
message:
tweak the Java code style

* In method declarations, indent 4 spaces for more parameters.

title: use AlarmManager.setAlarmClock() to wake from idle/doze
message:
use AlarmManager.setAlarmClock() to wake from idle/doze

This should cope with Android Marshmallow’s battery optimizing
features, but Developer Preview 3 is inadequate for testing.

Calling setAlarmClock() displays another timer icon in the
notification bar and lock screen with tap through to MainActivity
to edit the timer. It’s available on Lollipop+ so use it there.

setAlarmClock() uses RTC wall time instead of elapsed
interval time, so convert time bases and listen for clock
adjustments.

Hopefully it’s a UI improvement, but alas it displays the alarm time
as an absolute minute rather than an interval, and it could seem
broken since the alarm doesn’t happen at the turn of the minute.

title: show notifications even when the Activity is visible
message:
show notifications even when the Activity is visible

* This fixes a crash on Android Marshmallow trying to open an
audio-only alarm notification.
* This provides visible feedback in-activity when the alarm rings.
* This provides immediate feedback for opening/closing the
notification which is available on the Lollipop+ lockscreen.

So it’s worth bucking the style guide.

TODO: Test & decide whether to do this on KitKat and earlier.

TODO: Either remove the notification’s controls when the activity
is visible or make them update the activity.

title: Improve the TAB behavior in MainActivity, but it's very buggy.
message:
Improve the TAB behavior in MainActivity, but it's very buggy.

Even after a lot of experiments with these fragile attributes, the OS's
behavior (at least in the emulators) is buggy.

* Focus on the timer text doesn't show any signifier.
* Ditto for the check box in some OS versions and sometimes depending on
whether it's checked on. (This might be due to the Material Design theme.)
* TAB focus goes to the Reset button even when the button is hidden.
* TAB focus gets stuck at the number picker (the last widget in the
activity) in the API level 21 emulator. This makes focus on the number
picker useless since you can TAB there, type a number, and have no way to
make it accept the new number.
* The widgets need explicit android:focusable="true".
* The Reset button needs an explicit android:nextFocusForward attribute or
else it takes two TABs to get to the next widget.
* The arrow keys do nothing.
* In the API 16-17 emulators, TAB does nothing.
* In the API 15 & 12 emulators, TAB sometimes goes to the number picker's
UP or DOWN arrow, depending on whether the Reset button is visible and
whether the number picker is set to 1.

title: Fix 2 bugs arising from granting AlarmManager a time window.
message:
Fix 2 bugs arising from granting AlarmManager a time window.

AlarmReceiver schedules the next repeating alarm in [-window .. 0] of the
next repeating alarm time. This lets AlarmManager save battery power but
has subtle implications.

1. The notification's alarm count display was 1 low when Notifier runs a
little early to construct the notification.

2. The notification and its alarm sound can get restarted mid-stream when
rescheduling happens early enough to happen again before the actual alarm
time.

title: Fix the checkbox layout (overlaps its label)
message:
Fix the checkbox layout (overlaps its label)

Setting its padding (in particular its paddingLeft) overrides the
default padding which leaves barely enough room for the checkbox in API
levels < 17, and begins at the edge of the checkbox in API levels >= 17.
One could write a workaround that conditionally increases the checkbox's
left padding, but the default is good enough as long as we don't
override it with a fixed value.

See
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4037795/android-spacing-between-checkbox-and-text/4038195#4038195

As of Honeycomb (v11), an Activity is not "killable" until onStop() returns,

is HONEYCOMB_MR1 (v12) to get RemoteViews.setDisplayedChild().]

title: An experiment in putting a spatula image behind the widget.
message:
An experiment in putting a spatula image behind the widget.

Punted. `android:tileMode="clamp"` will replicate the edges but it
replicates the edges of a trimmed image for some reason, so the tip of the
spatula repeats across the image to the right. Also tileMode defeats the
android:gravity setting so the image sticks in the upper left corner.
`android:tileMode="repeat"` is too busy.

Stash the spatula image files and its background drawable XML file in
source-assets/.

title: Run Proguard & zipAlign in release builds. Configure the Gradle GUI.
message:
Run Proguard & zipAlign in release builds. Configure the Gradle GUI.

The project name contains a space. The Gradle GUI needs added quotes to run
the targets successfully.

title: Rename assets/ to source-assets/
message:
Rename assets/ to source-assets/

since assets/ means something to the Android Gradle build.

source-assets/ contains the Gimp *.xcf files and (someday) line art and
audio asset sources.

Also reorder the TODO list.

message:
Redraw the Reset icon with a larger arrow head.

Also experiment with 2-layer Pause, Play, & Reset icons (orange on white).
But I didn't like them so don't convert these Gimp .xcf files to ic_*.png.

message:

message: Rename icon resources to ic_*. Remove right margin from the pause/play button.

title: Adjust for consistent widget layout on Jelly Bean.
message:
Adjust for consistent widget layout on Jelly Bean.

The widget was displaying running chronometer text right justified and
paused text left justified. The fix is to make the horizontal LinearLayout
the place to do gravity="right".

Also it was resizing the start/stop button. The workaround is to explicitly
set the ViewFlipper to measureAllChildren="false" even though that's the
default.

Also turn on ellipsize="end". Does it work?

Add contentDescription to the start/stop ImageButton for accessibility.

title: Battery power savings
message:
Battery power savings

* When the timer is paused, stop the app widget's Chronometer in case a not-displayed Chronometer still runs a timer.
* Check if there are any app widgets before updating them all (on start/stop/reset).

* Add implementation notes to README.md.

message:

so paused widgets match running widgets, even though 0:01 and 1:02:03 look better than 00:01 and 01:02:03.

title: <include> fragment_main insteado of via a Fragment.
message:
<include> fragment_main insteado of via a Fragment.

This fixes the crash on orientation change in Jelly Bean -- every Fragment subclass needs a no-arg constructor so a non-static inner class won't work.
